McConnell must hold a vote on #HR1 so we can end partisan gerrymandering for good.

The American people deserve a redistricting process that’s impartial and transparent, and that respects their voice. We will continue to demand action from @senatemajldr McConnell – who currently stands, with his arms folded, in the way of justice and fairness in our democracy.
In March, we passed #HR1, the #ForThePeople Act – a bill that I spearheaded – which would establish independent redistricting commissions to draw the lines fairly in states across the country.

However, in its ruling, the Court underscores the urgent need for Congress to fix this practice by passing national, comprehensive redistricting reform – and House Democrats are already leading the fight.

Once again, the Supreme Court has sided against the interests of the American people – this time by failing to put an end to extreme partisan gerrymandering:  https://sarbanes.house.gov/media-center/press-releases/sarbanes-statement-scotus-decision-permit-extreme-partisan ….

Here's my statement on the Supreme Court's decision to block the Trump Administration from including a citizenship question on the U.S. Census:  https://sarbanes.house.gov/media-center/press-releases/sarbanes-statement-scotus-census-decision ….
My colleagues and I believe that every American voter matters, and that every vote must count. That’s why we remain committed to restoring the Voting Rights Act. #RestoreTheVRA #RestoreTheVOTE
Shortly thereafter, @HouseDemocrats introduced #HR4, the Voting Rights Advancement Act – led by my colleague @RepTerriSewell of Alabama – to reverse the Supreme Court’s Shelby decision.

But @HouseDemocrats are fighting back against these cynical efforts. As our first order of business, we introduced and passed #HR1, the #ForThePeople Act, which helps improve access to the ballot box and builds the case to restore the Voting Rights Act.

Almost immediately after this misguided decision, conservative-led legislatures in states across the country began imposing stringent new obstacles to the ballot box – including voter ID laws and other voter suppression schemes – that take direct aim at people of color.

Six years ago today, the Supreme Court’s conservative majority gutted the Voting Rights Act and weakened critical protections for American voters:  https://democracyreform-sarbanes.house.gov/newsroom/press-releases/sarbanes-statement-on-sixth-anniversary-of-shelby-county-v-holder-decision …. pic.twitter.com/OuIrgbMKYV
The bill would also provide veterans with the care, respect and services they deserve, ensure clean air and clean water, protect public lands and fund climate research.

H.R. 3055, an appropriations bill, would help communities tackle the opioid crisis, improve affordable housing, invest in highways, airports, bridges, railways and seaports, enhance public safety and help hardworking families put food on the table.
Today, I helped secure millions more federal dollars for Maryland. https://sarbanes.house.gov/media-center/press-releases/sarbanes-secures-additional-federal-funding-maryland-families …

The President’s callous threat to forcibly separate migrant families in Baltimore and across the country serves no useful purpose. Fear-mongering is not a policy. It is a crass, nativist impulse that breeds intolerance when what we need in our country is hope and humanity.

I look forward to passing the #SAFEAct in the full U.S. House of Representatives next week, and I hope that my @HouseGOP colleagues – and our @SenateGOP colleagues – will join this critical effort to protect our country and our democracy.

The Mueller Report, along with many assessments from our country’s intelligence community, make a clear case that we can expect foreign adversaries to attacks our elections in 2020. We’ve got to be ready.

The #SAFEAct will:

✅ Modernize our election systems.
✅ Authorize new funds to improve election infrastructure; and
✅ Ensure the accuracy and integrity of our elections.

Today, @HouseAdm_Dems – led by @RepZoeLofgren – took another step forward in @HouseDemocrats’ plan to protect American elections from foreign intrusion and guard against foreign influence in our democracy by successfully reporting out the #SAFEAct.

They deserve investment advisors that put their financial interests first. But today’s efforts by the SEC will move us further away from this basic standard and make it even harder for American families to receive appropriate and conflict-free financial advice.

These lower standards will end up costing American workers billions of dollars every year. Many Americans rely on sound investment advice – free of gimmicks and conflicts of interest – in order to save for retirement and build a healthy financial future.

Today, the Securities and Exchange Commission cynically advanced a new rule that will hurt hardworking American families and retirees by watering down important consumer protections meant to ensure that people receive fair and beneficial investment advice. https://sarbanes.house.gov/media-center/press-releases/sarbanes-statement-sec-s-anti-consumer-effort-weaken-investment …
